trans-unit.source: Changes the size of a previously allocated block of task memory

seg-source.mrk: Changes the size of a previously allocated block of task memory

target.mrk: Changes the size of a previously allocated block of task memory

trans-unit.source: The pointer to the memory block to be reallocated.

seg-source.mrk: The pointer to the memory block to be reallocated.

target.mrk: The pointer to the memory block to be reallocated.

trans-unit.source: The size of the memory block to be reallocated, in bytes.

seg-source.mrk: The size of the memory block to be reallocated, in bytes.

target.mrk: The size of the memory block to be reallocated, in bytes.

trans-unit.source: If $pMemory is 0, function allocates a new memory block in the same way as the _WinAPI_CoTaskMemAlloc() function.

seg-source.mrk: If $pMemory is 0, function allocates a new memory block in the same way as the _WinAPI_CoTaskMemAlloc() function.

target.mrk: If $pMemory is 0, function allocates a new memory block in the same way as the _WinAPI_CoTaskMemAlloc() function.

trans-unit.source: If $pMemory is not 0, it should be a pointer returned by a prior call to _WinAPI_CoTaskMemAlloc().

seg-source.mrk: If $pMemory is not 0, it should be a pointer returned by a prior call to _WinAPI_CoTaskMemAlloc().

target.mrk: If $pMemory is not 0, it should be a pointer returned by a prior call to _WinAPI_CoTaskMemAlloc().

trans-unit.source: The contents of the block are unchanged up to the shorter of the new and old sizes, although the new block can be in a different location.

seg-source.mrk: The contents of the block are unchanged up to the shorter of the new and old sizes, although the new block can be in a different location.

target.mrk: The contents of the block are unchanged up to the shorter of the new and old sizes, although the new block can be in a different location.

trans-unit.source: If $pMemory is not 0 and $iSize is 0, then the memory pointed to by $pMemory is freed.

seg-source.mrk: If $pMemory is not 0 and $iSize is 0, then the memory pointed to by $pMemory is freed.

target.mrk: If $pMemory is not 0 and $iSize is 0, then the memory pointed to by $pMemory is freed.
